comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: This appears to relate to the Szabo murder case. NYTimes article (ref below) mentions a conference at the office of the Austro-Hungarian Consul, including: Franz Fischerauer, the Vice Consul Arpad Kremer, attorney for the Consulate the article also mentions Dr. Breitenfeld "representing the Consul General" concerning the autopsy of Mrs. Szabo. BELIEVES HEARING WILL FREE GIBSON; His Counsel Confident That the Prisoner Won't Be Indicted for Mrs. Szabo's Murder. September 25, 1912, Wednesday query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9B0DE5D71630E2...
